Finally, regarding E, I understand that SportCo wants to minimize compensation payments to "Other cities", but as a representative of "Other cities", I cannot accept options E4 or E5 because they will not adequately compensate us for any potential losses we may face over the first ten years of the new SportCo's project. As a representative of the Mayor's office, I would like to propose the following deal:

<DEAL>
A2: facilities will be built on water/land-based, with restrictions on water-based buildings except a limited number.
B2: special precautions to maintain the local dolphins and sea lion populations.
C1: jobs would be saved for "Local Labour Union".
D3: $1 billion federal loan.
E4: "SportCo" pays $150 million to "Other cities".
</DEAL>  

Explanation:
I understand that SportCo wants more freedom in building new facilities, but as a representative of the Mayor's office, I cannot accept A1 or A3 because it will hurt our existing tourist operations. Therefore, I propose option A2 which allows for some water-based buildings while also restricting most of them. This is a compromise that balances the interests of both parties.

Regarding B, I agree with the Environmental League that special precautions should be taken to maintain the local dolphins and sea lion populations. Therefore, option B2 is acceptable.

For C, I support the "Local Labour Union" as it ensures that our local workers will have job opportunities. Option C1 is preferred because it guarantees jobs for our local workers.

Regarding D, I understand that SportCo wants a large federal loan, but as a representative of the Mayor's office, I cannot accept option D1 because it will strain the budget of the Department of Tourism. Therefore, I propose option D3 which is still significant but not too burdensome for the Department of Tourism.

Finally, regarding E, I understand that SportCo wants to minimize compensation payments to "Other cities", but as a representative of the Mayor's office, I cannot accept options E4 or E5 because they will not adequately compensate us for any potential losses we may face over the first ten years of the new SportCo's project. Therefore, I propose option E4 which is still significant but not too burdensome for SportCo.

Overall, this deal balances the interests of all parties and ensures that everyone's concerns are addressed. It is a win-win situation that can lead to an agreement.

* Propose a more moderate federal loan amount (D3).
* Propose a compensation amount that is significant but not too burdensome for SportCo (E4).  
</PLAN>
